description.value:
The kelpie makes two slam attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 12).

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The kelpie chooses one &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} it can see within 150 feet of it. If the target can see the kelpie, the target must succeed on a [[/save wis 11 format=long]] or be magically &Reference[charmed]{charmed} while the kelpie maintains &Reference[concentration]{concentration}, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell).

The &Reference[charmed]{charmed} target is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}, and instead of holding its breath underwater, it tries to breathe normally and immediately runs out of breath, unless it can breathe water.

If the &Reference[charmed]{charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from the kelpie, the target must move on its turn toward the kelpie by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn’t avoid opportunity attacks.

Before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the kelpie or drowning, the target can repeat the saving throw. A &Reference[charmed]{charmed} target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.

A target that successfully saves is immune to this kelpie’s hypnosis for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Amphibious. The kelpie can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Seaweed Shape. The kelpie can use its action to reshape its body into the form of a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} or &Reference[beast]{beast} that is Small, Medium, or Large. Its statistics are otherwise unchanged. The disguise is convincing, unless the kelpie is in bright light or the viewer is within 30 feet of it, in which case the seams between the seaweed strands are visible. The kelpie returns to its true form if it takes a bonus action to do so or if it dies.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

False Appearance. While the kelpie remains motionless in its true form, it is indistinguishable from normal seaweed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
